item.description:
What is man's greatest virtues?



Movie synopsis from www.atlasshruggedpart1.com: "Dagny Taggart (Taylor Schilling) runs Taggart Transcontinental, the largest remaining railroad company in America, with intelligence, courage and integrity, despite the systematic disappearance of her best and most competent workers.
  She is drawn to industrialist Henry Rearden (Grant Bowler), one of the few men whose genius and commitment to his own ideas match her own. Rearden's super-strength metal alloy, Rearden Metal, holds the promise that innovation can overcome the slide into anarchy."

In 1957, Ayn Rand's book, Atlas Shrugged was first released.  It has never gone out of print. The fictional work deals with issues of individualism, rights, the role of the state, altruism, free minds and free markets.

We will catch an early evening showing.  I'll post the exact time once the theater has them. After the movie we'll go get a drink and discuss the movie, and other works by Ayn Rand.
item.how_to_find_us: We will meet in the movie lobby near the stair case at 6:15 PM, Movie showtime: 6:50 PM
item.why: "Why ask useless questions? How deep is the ocean? How high is the sky? Who is John Galt?"
item.name: Who is John Galt? (Atlas Shrugged Movie) 6:50 PM show
